framework.name: Strategic Priority 1: People - Enhanced Social Equity and Well-being
framework.description: For Bahrain to realize its vision of a society where all individuals can fulfil their full potential, an all-of-government and all-of-society approach will be needed to build on the current broad-based access to basic services with targeted investments to enhance human capabilities and determinants

framework.name: Strategic Priority 2: Prosperity - Sustainable Economic Transformation
framework.description: Bahrain is navigating a critical phase of economic transformation, enhancing diversification and stability amidst global and regional challenges, at the same time as it seeks to reduce fiscal dependence on its fossil fuel revenues. framework.name: Strategic Priority 3: Peace - Governance for Justice and Human Rights
framework.description: Bahrain aspires to improve its governance structures, legal frameworks, and enforcement mechanisms to protect human rights and facilitate justice. This aspiration is embedded in its Economic Vision 2030, the Government Plan 2023-2026 and the National Human Rights Action Plan 2022-2026. Achieving uni

Output 3.2: Strengthened data-driven governance and participatory decision-making, ensuring women, youth, and persons with disabilities have an active role in public space for decision-making.

framework.name: Strategic Priority 4: Planet - Resilient Environmental Stewardship
